poem:
Title: "In the Shadow of the Gun"

Mute bells toll in the tremulous dawn,
Man-hunter's quest ends; on silent street alone stands the guilty.
Andre, young as the day, barricaded in despair, 
His hands bearing the stigma of mortality. 
O Philadelphia, do your streets remember 
Tales of hope that once danced in light?
Yet here lies the bereft eve,
Painted in hues of unquiet night.
